intro: Odontonema macrophyllum, commonly known as the velvetleaf strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in length. The plant produces striking clusters of purple or violet flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for botanical gardens and shaded landscapes.
